data.title: Just Okay
data.text: I have been staying at the DoubleTree for years and eating in the Grill on a few occasions.  Overall not bad but recently my meal was not great at all.  It was on a Monday night not busy but took forever for the server to come over.  When she did finally take the order, she forgot my soup (which, btw, was the best piece of the dinner) and delivered the main course and soup, ultimately, at the same time.  My burger, just a burger, nothing special was over cooked.  They offered to comp me but I did eat it as I was very hungry.  Not only that but it took no less than 15-20 minutes to get my check after I was done.  Just not a good visit this time around.

data.title: Take the suggestion of the waitress_she's perfect!
data.text: I did not know what to eat but the waitress did it all -even the adult beverage- and it was superkalifragisticespyalidoughious!

data.title: Good stuff
data.text: In the downstairs section of the DoubleTree in downtown Pittsburgh and a cool little spot to grab a bite to eat or a drink. Yes it is a bit on the high side in regards to pricing but considering the location it is normal. TVs for sports viewing and a pretty good menu to say the least.

data.title: Had Me[h] Breakfast...for adventures fuel
data.text: Visited the place because it was located in the hotel I stayed for my area visit. It took about 10 minutes to be seated. Since I came down later morning not sure why it took so long. Only one party, literally one person, in front of me and a small group of 2 or 3 as I recall. Since I was trying to save some time I had the buffet. Choices were scramble eggs, with or without cheese, home fries, bacon, sausage links, oatmeal, various breads, some cold cereals and a little bit of fresh fruit. Eggs tasted different than my home area as well as the potatoes. The waitress was quick and friendly. Prices were fair. They are open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Open early to late. They also have a bar area which I didn't visit. Overall its nice and clean with comfortable and tasteful decoration design.

data.title: Expensive hotel breakfast
data.text:
While the offerings were a bit more with hearty meals for breakfast, comparing the breakfast offerings a sister chain Hampton Inn, not a good value for the cost.
The area with seating and layout is fine and the staff service is great.

data.title: Good meal
data.text: Great waitress, very knowledgeable- homemade gnocchi was very good, zucchini cakes not so good, only 3 scallops were on the scallop entree

data.title: The food was surprisingly very good!
data.text:
I don't usually like hotel restaurants.  They tend to be over priced and to be honest, bad.  I was so pleasantly surprised by the Bigelow Grille.  First meal we came for lunch.  We wanted to sit on the patio and they accommodated us even though it was raining.  The food was really good.  I had an awesome burger and fries and my two daughters had mac and cheese with bacon in it.  My youngest had the meatballs over polenta.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  
The next morning we had the breakfast buffet - I know what you're thinking - horrible but you're wrong!  The buffet was wonderful, the eggs were light and fluffy, the croissants were flaky, the bacon was crispy, the sausage was browned to perfection.  They really made certain that the food was delicious.
Dinner was steak - it was so tender and cooked very well.  The fries were incredible.
Next time I go to Pittsburgh I am certainly going to eat there again!

data.title: Ravioli
data.text: Excellent, out of this world, really good. The quality of the food was really good, the service was nice but they have to improve.

data.title: Convenient!
data.text: We recently stayed at the Doubletree and made use of this restaurant for breakfast both mornings we were there. The buffet is very convenient, and the usual food...no complaints. We also ate dinner one evening. The hamburgers were out of this world, as was the hanger steak. However the "heirloom" tomatoes and potatoes turned out to be not heirloom. All in all, the staff was great...the food was terrific.

data.title: great
data.text: The staff was extremely friendly and were were that at 9 pm on a Monday night.  The food was very good we picked the special of the evening

data.title: Good food and service,...but
data.text: We were staying at the DoubleTree Hotel and ate at this attached restaurant several times.   When it was not crowded, it was excellent.   The food is good, and the servers are very helpful.   However, as others have mentioned, management does not seem to know how to prepare for large crowds.   On the Saturday of our stay, Pittsburgh hosted a marathon, the U of Pittsburgh graduation, and an afternoon Pirates game.   At breakfast, the staff appeared to be overwhelmed, and I saw several people leave after having no one acknowledge that they were waiting for a table.   I cannot fathom that management did not know well in advance that this would be a busy weekend.   On other days, the situation was fine.

owner_response.author: Ryan K, Manager at Bigelow Grille, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear AMF_10,
Thank your for taking the time to offer us feedback into your dining experience at the Bigelow Grille. Our goal is to provide exceptional service and delicious food to all who dine with us. I'm glad to hear that all except one of your experiences with us were enjoyable, however I do apologize for the long wait you encountered during that busy Saturday morning. I will share your feedback with the management team as we continually look for ways to improve our operations. We hope to see you dine with us again, until then, safe travels!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Breakfast Place only!!
data.text: My son and I were staying at the Doubletree for the New Year Events.  We arrived and our room was not ready, the hotel manage kindly gave us a $60 credit for "snacks" in the Bigelow Grille.  I could not find one thing I would eat, as I am somewhat picky.  The kid, ordered a crab cake sandwich and a salad that looked like they had stripped plants in the lobby to make.  I settled on a side of pierogies, and a nasty tasting iced tea. The handsome waiter Scott, ordered me a double order to use most of the credit. The next morning we were given vouchers for breakfast, the breakfast buffet is wonderful, small but wonderful.  The only disappointment, Scott was not working.

owner_response.author: Ryan K, Manager at Bigelow Grille, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear JamesZ62,
Thank you so much for taking the time to offer us feedback about you experience in our Restaurant. It's unfortunate that you were not able to find anything on our Menu that you liked. However I am happy to hear your child enjoyed the Crab Cake Sandwich, and that you enjoyed having Scott wait on you. We hope to see you try us again as our Restaurant has just been renovated, and menu updated. Until then, safe travels!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Did they even know there was a Steelers home game on Sunday?
data.text: We stayed at the Doubletree Hotel Downtown because of the proximity to Heinz Field.  After the game we came back to the hotel to eat and the wait was quoted as "1 hour."  We decided to wait and the lack of service at the bar forced us to go to our room and get a beverage.  We finally were sat, (party of 4) and the nightmare begins.  We ordered drinks, beers and waters and in what seemed an eternity, they finally came out.  There was a person at the hostess station / door that wasn't much help to anyone as tables were dirty all around the dining room.  The waitress, Katie, was very pleasant and doing the best she could with all of the tables she had going, which when we looked around the dining room, there was one other server!  The line at the door was getting longer and the bar was backed up.  It literally took an hour and a half to get their "Signature Burger" which advertised pork belly, (it came without it) Macaroni and cheese, pulled pork tacos and a soup and salad.  The burger was dry and overcooked.  The server tried but she could only do so much.  There was never any management presence on the floor to assist and the experience put a damper to an otherwise fantastic trip to Pittsburgh.  I wouldn't recommend the restaurant after a game at Heinz Field.

data.title: Tricked again!
data.text:
This was "Light up night" in P-burgh. After trying to get reservations at a number of other restaurants, we resorted to the facility in the Doubletree where we were staying, They were not that busy, though had to go through main desk several times to get restaurant to pick up the phone.

Ordered a basic bottle of Montpelllier Pinot Noir at the usual 300% mark-up that such restaurants charge. Ordered a garden salad to split and my wife ordered the rainbow trout and I asked for the hanger steak mains. Waitress asked if we wanted an extra egg on each of the half salads, we said yes. Lived to regret that move...

Salads came out, OK. Mains came out and steak was good - medium rare as ordered. I noticed my wife's trout looked very small as we usually trade tastes. Looking closer, I saw that they gave her maybe 3-4 oz. of a very thin half-fillet - maybe 2 x 5" and about 3/8" thick of trout. She never complains, and much to her chagrin, I had to flag down the waitress (who had not served the food) to ask if this was a mistake. She said we could talk to the manager if we wanted - said we said yes please. When he ultimately came out, he claimed the trout was running small at about 8oz. I pointed out that it wasn't even half of that. He did ask what we wanted, and we said we would live with that, but was reporting for their benefit that this would never be acceptable to most customers but my wife wasn't very hungry after a late lunch and her recent surgery limiting her appetite .I told him that was the most skimpy main portion I had ever seen at any restaurant, ever, but he didn't budge from his position.

So the bill comes, and the waitress explains he has taken 10% ($8) off. However, as we review the bill, they charged us $8 for the extra egg on the salad, and $2 to split it.  Net - we paid $18 for 2 half salads and could have had 2 whole salads for $16 since they were priced $8 ea. Good trick! This obviously more than offset the manager's $8 discount for the half trout debacle.

I had already been writing in a 25% tip for the waitress since it did't seem to be here fault at first, and didn't want to leave the impression that we were cheap customers. In retrospect, she should have divulged the $10 uncharge for the extra salad issues and none of the staff ever expressed any remorse for the disappointing experience.

I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone who isn't desperate to have an evening meal as we were after a 6 hour all day drive to Pittsburgh. Pretty pathetic.

data.title: It was OK
data.text: Several items on the menu were unavailable. That's a restaurant management failure. Service was OK, but I won't return.

data.title: Hotel Dining
data.text: The Bigelow is attached to the Doubletree Hotel and used mainly by hotel guests. The menu is restricted resulting in limited choice. The food myself and my wife had was of good quality and well presented.  The staff were pleasant but short in numbers in my opinion.

data.title: Had Buffet Breakfast Only
data.text: The buffet breakfasts offers many of the options that many hotels offer to guest as part of the stay. The staff was very friendly and the service was good, the food was sub par and over priced for the quality.

data.title: Tomato Soup
data.text: After a long day, we decided to just go downstairs and have dinner. The tomato soup was delicious. My son had the roasted chicken, nothing but bones on his plate when he was done, I believe he really enjoyed it. I had the smoked brisket tacos, a little too smoky for me.

data.title: not too impressed.
data.text: Wasnt too impressed with this place. The floor was sticky, and when we were there it wasnt busy and there were plenty of dirty tables, Food was ho hum.

data.title: A really good hotel restaurant!!
data.text: I usually avoid restaurants in the hotels I'm staying at.  So glad I made this exception. It was nice to just get in the elevator to get 'home' for the night.  Fresh tasting.  Creative combinations.  I had a difficult time making a decision on my entree.  The server was great, made excellent suggestions, friendly - that good Pittsburgh hospitality, and timed all the courses perfectly.  The manager checked in with me and asked if I was happy with the food and the service.  I always appreciate that.
